class EmailService {\n    private static final Logger LOGGER = Logger.getLogger(EmailService.class.getName());\n    \n    // Configuration constants\n    private static final int MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS = 3;\n    private static final long RETRY_DELAY_MS = 1000;\n    private static final String EMAIL_SUBJECT = "Disciplinary Note Notification";\n    private static final String EMAIL_FROM = "school@example.edu";\n    \n    /**\n     * Sends a notification email to the parent regarding a disciplinary note.\n     * This method simulates email sending and includes error handling.\n     * \n     * @param note The disciplinary note for which to send notification\n     * @return true if email was sent successfully, false otherwise\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if note is null\n     */\n    public boolean sendNotificationToParent(Note note) {\n        if (note == null) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Note cannot be null");\n        }\n        \n        try {\n            // Validate note before processing\n            note.validate();\n            \n            // Get parent email from note (in real system, this would be from database)\n            String parentEmail = note.getParentEmail();\n            \n            LOGGER.info("Preparing to send email to parent: " + parentEmail);\n            \n            // Attempt to send email with retry logic\n            for (int attempt = 1; attempt <= MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS; attempt++) {\n                try {\n                    LOGGER.info("Email send attempt " + attempt + " of " + MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS);\n                    \n                    // Simulate email sending (in real system, this would use JavaMail or similar)\n                    boolean success = simulateEmailSending(note, parentEmail);\n                    \n                    if (success) {\n                        LOGGER.info("Email sent successfully to " + parentEmail);\n                        logEmailDetails(note, parentEmail);\n                        return true;\n                    } else {\n                        LOGGER.warning("Email sending failed on attempt " + attempt);\n                        \n                        // If not the last attempt, wait before retrying\n                        if (attempt < MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS) {\n                            LOGGER.info("Retrying in " + RETRY_DELAY_MS + "ms...");\n                            TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS.sleep(RETRY_DELAY_MS);\n                        }\n                    }\n                } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n                    LOGGER.log(Level.WARNING, "Email sending interrupted", e);\n                    Thread.currentThread().interrupt();\n                    return false;\n                } catch (Exception e) {\n                    LOGGER.log(Level.SEVERE, "Unexpected error during email sending attempt " + attempt, e);\n                    \n                    // For unexpected errors, we still retry unless it\'s the last attempt\n                    if (attempt == MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS) {\n                        LOGGER.severe("All email sending attempts failed");\n                        return false;\n                    }\n                    \n                    try {\n                        TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS.sleep(RETRY_DELAY_MS);\n                    } catch (InterruptedException ie) {\n                        Thread.currentThread().interrupt();\n                        return false;\n                    }\n                }\n            }\n            \n            LOGGER.severe("Failed to send email after " + MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS + " attempts");\n            return false;\n            \n        } catch (IllegalStateException e) {\n administration if you have any questions.\\n\\n" +\n               "Sincerely,\\n" +\n               "School Administration\\n" +\n               "---\\n" +\n               "This is an automated Please do not reply to this email.";\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Logs email details for auditing purposes.\n     * \n     * @param note The disciplinary note\n     * @param parentEmail The parent\'s email address\n     */\n    private void logEmailDetails(Note note, String parentEmail) {\n        LOGGER.info("Email audit log:");\n        LOGGER.info("  Student: " + note.getStudent());\n        LOGGER.info("  Parent Email: " + parentEmail);\n        LOGGER.info("  Date Sent: " + java.time.LocalDateTime.now());\n        LOGGER.info("  Note Date: " + note.getDate());\n        LOGGER.info("  Teacher: " + note.getTeacher());\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validates an email address format (basic validation).\n     * \n     * @param email The email address to validate\n     * @return true if email format appears valid, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean isValidEmailFormat(String email) {\n        if (email == null || email.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Basic email format validation\n        String emailRegex = "^[A-Za-z0-9+_.-]+@[A-Za-z0-9.-]+\\\\.[A-Za-z]{2,}$";\n        return email.matches(emailRegex);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the configured maximum retry attempts.\n     * \n     * @return Maximum number of retry attempts\n     */\n    public int getMaxRetryAttempts() {\n        return MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the retry delay in milliseconds.\n     * \n     * @return Retry delay in milliseconds\n     */\n    public long getRetryDelayMs() {\n        return RETRY_DELAY_MS;\n    }\n}\n\nCommand Plan.finish_current_task executed:Current task is finished. List<Note> notesDatabase;\n    private final EmailService emailService;\n    \n    /**\n     * Default constructor that creates its own EmailService instance.\n     * Useful for simple applications LOGGER.info("NoteService initialized with default EmailService");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructor with dependency injection for EmailService.\n     * Useful for testing and better separation of concerns.\n     * \n     * @param emailService The EmailService instance to use for notifications\n     */\n    public NoteService(EmailService emailService) {\n        this.notesDatabase = new CopyOnWriteArrayList<>();\n        this.emailService = emailService;\n        LOGGER.info("NoteService initialized with provided EmailService");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Saves a disciplinary note to the system.\n     * Performs validation, saves to simulated database, and triggers email notification.\n     * \n     * @param note The note to save\n     * @return true if note was saved successfully, false otherwise\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if note is null\n     */\n    public boolean saveNote(Note note) {\n        if (note == null) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Note cannot be null");\n        }\n        \n        LOGGER.info("Attempting to save note for student: " + note.getStudent());\n        \n        try {\n            // Step 1: Validate note\n            note.validate();\n            LOGGER.fine("Note validation passed");\n            \n            // Step 2: Check for duplicates (optional business rule)\n            if (isDuplicateNote(note)) {\n                LOGGER.warning("Possible duplicate note detected for student: " + note.getStudent());\n                // In some systems, duplicates might be allowed\n                // For this system, we allow duplicates but log a warning\n            }\n            \n            // Step 3: Save to simulated database\n            boolean saved = saveToDatabase(note);\n            if (!saved) {\n                LOGGER.severe("Failed to save note to database for student: " + note.getStudent());\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n            LOGGER.info("Note saved to database for student: " + note.getStudent());\n            \n            // Step 4: Send email notification to parent\n            LOGGER.info("Triggering email notification for student: " + note.getStudent());\n            boolean emailSent = emailService.sendNotificationToParent(note);\n            \n            if (emailSent) {\n                LOGGER.info("Email notification sent successfully for student: " + note.getStudent());\n            } else {\n                LOGGER.warning("Email notification failed for student: " + note.getStudent() + \n                              ", but note was saved to database");\n                // Note: The note is still saved even if email fails\n                // This is a business decision - some systems might require successful email\n                // For this use case, we consider the note saved successfully\n            }\n            \n            // Step 5: Log the operation for auditing\n            logNoteOperation(note, "INSERT");\n            \n            return true;\n            \n        } catch (IllegalStateException e) {\n            LOGGER.log(Level.SEVERE, "Note validation failed: " + e.getMessage(), e);\n            return false;\n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            LOGGER.log(Level.SEVERE, "Unexpected error while saving note", e);\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Saves the note to the simulated database.\n     * In a real application, this would use JDBC, JPA, or another persistence mechanism.\n     * \n     * @param note The note to save\n     * @return true if save was successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean saveToDatabase(Note note) {\n        try {\n            // Simulate database operations\n            // In a real system, this would involve:\n            // 1. Opening database connection\n            // 2. Executing INSERT statement\n            // 3. Handling transactions\n            // 4. Closing resources\n            \n            // Simulate occasional database failures (5% chance)\n            if (Math.random() < 0.05) {\n                LOGGER.severe("Simulated database connection failure");\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n            // Add note to the list (simulating database insert)\n            notesDatabase.add(note.copy()); // Store a copy to prevent external modification\n            \n            // Simulate database write delay\n            Thread.sleep(100);\n            \n            LOGGER.fine("Note saved to simulated database: " + note.getStudent());\n            return true;\n            \n        } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n            LOGGER.log(Level.WARNING, "Database operation interrupted", e);\n            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();\n            return false;\n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            LOGGER.log(Level.SEVERE, "Database error while saving note", e);\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if a similar note already exists in the database.\n     * This is a simple duplicate detection - in a real system, this would be more sophisticated.\n     * \n     * @param note The note to check\n     * @return true if a similar note exists, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean isDuplicateNote(Note note) {\n        // Simple duplicate detection: same student, same date, similar description\n        return notesDatabase.stream()\n                .anyMatch(existingNote -> \n                    existingNote.getStudent().equalsIgnoreCase(note.getStudent()) &&\n                    existingNote.getDate().equals(note.getDate()) &&\n                    existingNote.getDescription().toLowerCase()\n                        .contains(note.getDescription().toLowerCase().substring(0, \n                            Math.min(10, note.getDescription().length()))));\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Retrieves all notes from the simulated database.\n     * \n     * @return List of all notes (copies to prevent modification of internal state)\n     */\n    public List<Note> getAllNotes() {\n        LOGGER.fine("Retrieving all notes from database");\n        // Return copies to protect internal data\n        List<Note> copies = new ArrayList<>();\n        for (Note note : notesDatabase) {\n            copies.add(note.copy());\n        }\n        return copies;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Finds notes by student name.\n     * \n     * @param studentName The student name to search for\n     * @return List of notes for the specified student\n     */\n    public List<Note> findNotesByStudent(String studentName) {\n        if (studentName == null || studentName.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Student name cannot be null or empty");\n        }\n        \n        LOGGER.fine("Searching notes for student: " + studentName);\n        List<Note> result = new ArrayList<>();\n        \n        for (Note note : notesDatabase) {\n            if (note.getStudent().equalsIgnoreCase(studentName.trim())) {\n                result.add(note.copy());\n            }\n        }\n        \n        LOGGER.fine("Found " + result.size() + " notes for student: " + studentName);\n        return result;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the total number of notes in the system.\n     * \n     * @return Count of notes\n     */\n    public int getNoteCount() {\n        return notesDatabase.size();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Clears all notes from the simulated database.\n     * WARNING: This is for testing/cleanup purposes only.\n     */\n    public void clearAllNotes() {\n        LOGGER.warning("Clearing all notes from database - total notes: " + notesDatabase.size());\n        notesDatabase.clear();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Logs note operations for auditing purposes.\n     * \n     * @param note The note being operated on\n     * @param operation The operation performed (INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, etc.)\n     */\n    private void logNoteOperation(Note note, String operation) {\n        LOGGER.info("Note operation audit:");\n        LOGGER.info("  Operation: " + operation);\n        LOGGER.info("  Student: " + note.getStudent());\n        LOGGER.info("  Date: " + note.getDate());\n        LOGGER.info("  Teacher: " + note.getTeacher());\n        LOGGER.info("  Timestamp: " + java.time.LocalDateTime.now());\n        LOGGER.info("  Database size: " + notesDatabase.size());\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the EmailService instance being used.\n     * \n     * @return The EmailService instance\n     */\n can be added here\n        // For example: check if teacher exists in system, if student is enrolled, etc.\n        LOGGER.fine("Note passed all validation checks");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * 008|/**
009| * Main program to simulate the InsertNote use case.
010| * This program demonstrates the sequence of events for inserting a disciplinary note:
011| * 1. Show form with fields (student, date, teacher, description)
012| * 2. User fills the form
013| * 3. User clicks "Save"
014| * 4. System saves note and sends email notification to parent
015| * 
016| * Postconditions:
017| * - Note data entered into system
018| * - Notification sent to parent
019| * - Returns to registry screen
020| * - SMOS server connection interrupted
021| */

026|    private EmailService emailService;
027|    private Scanner scanner;
028|

031|     */

035|        this.scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
036|    }

058|     */
059|    private void runUseCase() {
060|        try {
061|            // Event 1: Show form with fields
062|            System.out.println("Event 1: System shows form with the following fields:");
063|            System.out.println("----------------------------------------");
064|            
065|            // Event 2: User fills out the form
066|            Note note = fillNoteForm();
067|            
068|            // Event 3: User clicks "Save"
069|            System.out.println("\nEvent 3: User clicks 'Save' button");
070|            
071|            // Event 4: Save the note and send notification
072|            System.out.println("\nEvent 4: System processing...");
073|            boolean success = noteService.saveNote(note);
074|            
075|            if (success) {
076|                System.out.println("✓ Note saved successfully!");
077|                
078|                // Send email notification to parent
079|                boolean emailSent = emailService.sendNotificationToParent(note);
080|                if (emailSent) {
081|                    System.out.println("✓ Email notification sent to parent!");
082|                } else {
083|                    System.out.println("⚠ Email notification failed, but note was saved.");
084|                }
085|                
086|                // Postconditions
087|                handlePostconditions();
088|            } else {
089|                System.out.println("✗ Failed to save note. Please try again.");
090|            }
091|            
092|        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
093|            System.out.println("Error: " + e.getMessage());
094|            System.out.println("Please restart the process with valid data.");
095|        } catch (Exception e) {
096|            System.out.println("Unexpected error: " + e.getMessage());
097|            e.printStackTrace();
098|        } finally {
099|            // Clean up resources
100|            scanner.close();
101|            System.out.println("\nResources cleaned up.");
102|        }
103|    }
104|    
105|    /**
106|     * Simulates user filling out the note form
107|     * @return Note object with user-provided data
108|     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if validation fails
109|     */
110|    private Note fillNoteForm() throws IllegalArgumentException {
111|        System.out.println("\nEvent 2: User fills out the form");
112|        System.out.println("----------------------------------------");
113|        
114|        // Get student information
115|        System.out.print("Enter student name: ");
116|        String student = scanner.nextLine().trim();
117|        if (student.isEmpty()) {
118|            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Student name cannot be empty");
119|        }
120|        
121|        // Get date with validation
122|        LocalDate date = null;
123|        while (date == null) {
124|            System.out.print("Enter date (YYYY-MM-DD): ");
125|            String dateStr = scanner.nextLine().trim();
126|            try {
127|                date = LocalDate.parse(dateStr);
128|                // Validate date is not in the future
129|                if (date.isAfter(LocalDate.now())) {
130|                    System.out.println("Error: Date cannot be in the future");
131|                    date = null;
132|                }
133|            } catch (DateTimeParseException e) {
134|                System.out.println("Error: Invalid date format. Please use YYYY-MM-DD");
135|            }
136|        }
137|        
138|        // Get teacher information
139|        System.out.print("Enter teacher name: ");
140|        String teacher = scanner.nextLine().trim();
141|        if (teacher.isEmpty()) {
142|            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Teacher name cannot be empty");
143|        }
144|        
145|        // Get description
146|        System.out.print("Enter description: ");
147|        String description = scanner.nextLine().trim();
148|        if (description.isEmpty()) {
149|            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Description cannot be empty");
150|        }
151|        
152|        // Create and return the note
153|        Note note = new Note(student, date, teacher, description);
154|        System.out.println("\nForm completed successfully!");
155|        System.out.println("Preview:");
156|        System.out.println(note);
157|        
158|        return note;
159|    }

an existing plan to achieve the goal. A plan consists of one to 3 tasks.\nIf plan is created, you should track the progress and update the plan accordingly, such as Plan.finish_current_task, Plan.append_task, Plan.reset_task, Plan.replace_task, etc.\nWhen presented a current task, tackle the task using the available commands.\nPay close attention to new user message, review the conversation history, use RoleZero.reply_to_human to respond to new user requirement.\nNote:\n1. If you keeping encountering errors, unexpected situation, or you are not sure of proceeding, use RoleZero.ask_human to ask for help.\n2. Carefully review your progress at the current task, if your actions so far has not fulfilled the task instruction, you should continue with current task. Otherwise, finish current task by Plan.finish_current_task explicitly.\n3. Each time you finish a task, use RoleZero.reply_to_human to report your progress.\n4. Don\'t forget to append task first when all existing tasks are finished and new tasks are required.\n5. Avoid repeating tasks you have already completed. And end loop when all requirements are met.\nYou are an autonomous programmer\n\nThe special interface consists of a file editor that shows you 100 lines of a file at a time.\n\nYou can use terminal commands (e.g., cat, ls, cd) by calling Terminal.run_command.\n\nYou should carefully observe the behavior and results of the previous action, and avoid triggering repeated errors.\n\nIn addition to the terminal, I also provide additional tools. \n\nIf provided an issue link, you first action must be navigate to the issue page using Browser tool to understand the issue.\n\nYour must check if the repository exists at the current path. If it exists, navigate to the repository path. If the repository doesn\'t exist, please download it and then navigate to it.\nAll subsequent actions must be performed within this repository path. Do not leave this directory to execute any actions at any time.\n\nNote:\n\n1. If you open a file and need to get to an area around a specific line that is not in the first 100 lines, say line 583, don\'t just use the scroll_down command multiple times. Instead, use the Editor.goto_line command. It\'s much quicker. \n2. Always make sure to look at the currently open file and the current working directory (which appears right after the currently open file). System saves note and sends email notification to parent\n * \n * Postconditions:\n * - Note data entered into system\n * - Notification sent to parent\n * - Returns to registry screen\n * - SMOS server connection interrupted\n */\npublic class InsertNoteProgram {\n    \n    // Serv used by the program\n    private NoteService noteService;\n    private EmailService emailService;\n    private Scanner scanner;\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructor initializes serv and scanner\n     */\n    public InsertNoteProgram() {\n        this.noteService = new NoteService();\n        this.emailService = new EmailService();\n        this.scanner = new Scanner(System.in);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Main method - entry point of the program\n     * @param args command line arguments (not used)\n     */\n    public static void main(String[] args) {\n        System.out.println("=== InsertNote Use Case Simulation ===");\n        System.out.println("Preconditions checked:");\n        System.out.println("1. Please use YYYY-MM-DD");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        // Get teacher information\n        System.out.print("Enter teacher name: ");\n        String teacher = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        if (teacher.isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Teacher name cannot be empty");\n        }\n        \n        // Get description\n        System.out.print("Enter description: ");\n        String description = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        if (description.isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Description cannot be empty");\n        }\n        \n        // Create and return the note\n        Note note = new Note(student, date, teacher, description);\n        System.out.println("\\nForm completed successfully!");\n        System.out.println("Preview:");\n        System.out.println(note);\n        \n        return note;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Handles postconditions after note insertion\n     */\n    private void handlePostconditions() {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Postconditions ===");\n        System.out.println("1. equals(Object obj) {\n        if (this == obj) return true;\n        if (obj == null || getClass() != obj.getClass()) return false;\n        \n        Note other = (Note) obj;\n        return Objects.equals(student, other.student) &&\n               Objects.equals(date, other.date) &&\n               Objects.equals(teacher, other.teacher) &&\n               Objects.equals(description, other.description);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Generates a hash code for this note.\n     * @return Hash code based on all fields\n     */\n    @Override\n    public int hashCode() {\n        return Objects.hash(student, date, teacher, description);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validates all fields of the note.\n     * @throws IllegalStateException if any field is invalid\n     */\n    public void validate() {\n        if (student == null || student.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalStateException("Student name is not set");\n        }\n        if (date == null) {\n            throw new IllegalStateException("Date is not set");\n        }\n        if (date.isAfter(LocalDate.now())) {\n            throw new IllegalStateException("Date cannot be in the future");\n        }\n        if (teacher == null || teacher.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalStateException("Teacher name is not set");\n        }\n        if (description == null || description.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalStateException("Description is not set");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Creates a copy of this note.\n     * @return A new Note instance with the same field values\n     */\n    public Note copy() {\n        return new Note(student, date, teacher, description);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the parent email based on class EmailService {\n    private static final Logger LOGGER = Logger.getLogger(EmailService.class.getName());\n    \n    // Configuration constants\n    private static final int MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS = 3;\n    private static final long RETRY_DELAY_MS = 1000;\n    private static final String EMAIL_SUBJECT = "Disciplinary Note Notification";\n    private static final String EMAIL_FROM = "school@example.edu";\n    \n    /**\n     * Sends a notification email to the parent regarding a disciplinary note.\n     * This method simulates email sending and includes error handling.\n     * \n     * @param note The disciplinary note for which to send notification\n     * @return true if email was sent successfully, false otherwise\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if note is null\n     */\n    public boolean sendNotificationToParent(Note note) {\n        if (note == null) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Note cannot be null");\n        }\n        \n        try {\n            // Validate note before processing\n            note.validate();\n            \n            // Get parent email from note (in real system, this would be from database)\n logic\n            for (int attempt = 1; attempt <= MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS; attempt++) {\n                try {\n                    LOGGER.info("Email send attempt " + attempt + " of " + MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS);\n                    \n                    // Simulate email sending (in real system, this would use JavaMail or similar)\n                    boolean success = simulateEmailSending(note, parentEmail);\n                    \n                    if (success) {\n                        LOGGER.info("Email sent successfully to " + parentEmail);\n LOGGER.info("Retrying in " + RETRY_DELAY_MS + "ms...");\n                            TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS.sleep(RETRY_DELAY_MS);\n                        }\n                    }\n                } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n                    LOGGER.log(Level.WARNING, "Email sending interrupted", e);\n                    Thread.currentThread().interrupt();\n                    return false;\n                } catch (Exception e) {\n                    LOGGER.log(Level.SEVERE, "Unexpected error during email sending attempt " + attempt, e);\n                    \n                    // For unexpected errors, we still retry unless it\'s the last attempt\n                    if (attempt == MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS) {\n                        LOGGER.severe("All email sending attempts failed");\n                        return false;\n                    }\n                    \n                    try {\n                        TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS.sleep(RETRY_DELAY_MS);\n                    } catch (InterruptedException ie) {\n                        Thread.currentThread().interrupt();\n                        return false;\n                    }\n                }\n 022|public class InsertNoteProgram {
023|    
024|    // Serv used by the program
025|    private NoteService noteService;
026|    private EmailService emailService;
027|    private Scanner scanner;
028|    
029|    /**
030|     * Constructor initializes serv and scanner
031|     */
032|    public InsertNoteProgram() {
033|        this.noteService = new NoteService();
034|        this.emailService = new EmailService();
035|        this.scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
036|    }
037|    
038|    /**
039|     * Main method - entry point of the program
040|     * @param args command line arguments (not used)
041|     */
042|    public static void main(String[] args) {
043|        System.out.println("=== InsertNote Use Case Simulation ===");
044|        System.out.println("Preconditions checked:");
045|        System.out.println("1. User logged in as administrator ✓");
046|        System.out.println("2. 'SviewTetTingloregister' use case completed ✓");
047|        System.out.println("3. 'ViewElonconote' use case completed ✓");
048|        System.out.println("4. 'New Note' button clicked ✓\n");
049|        
050|        InsertNoteProgram program = new InsertNoteProgram();
051|        program.runUseCase();
052|        
053|        System.out.println("\n=== Use Case Completed Successfully ===");
054|    }
055|    
056|    /**
057|     * Runs the complete InsertNote use case sequence
058|     */
059|    private void runUseCase() {
060|        try {
061|            // Event 1: Show form with fields
062|            System.out.println("Event 1: System shows form with the following fields:");
063|            System.out.println("----------------------------------------");
064|            
065|            // Event 2: User fills out the form
066|            Note note = fillNoteForm();
067|            
068|            // Event 3: User clicks "Save"
069|            System.out.println("\nEvent 3: User clicks 'Save' button");
070|            
071|            // Event 4: Save the note and send notification
072|            System.out.println("\nEvent 4: System processing...");
073|            boolean success = noteService.saveNote(note);
074|            
075|            if (success) {
076|                System.out.println("✓ Note saved successfully!");
077|                
078|                // Send email notification to parent
079|                boolean emailSent = emailService.sendNotificationToParent(note);
080|                if (emailSent) {
081|                    System.out.println("✓ Email notification sent to parent!");
082|                } else {
083|                    System.out.println("⚠ Email notification failed, but note was saved.");
084|                }
085|                
086|                // Postconditions
087|                handlePostconditions();
088|            } else {
089|                System.out.println("✗ Failed to save note. Please try again.");
090|            }
091|            
092|        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
093|            System.out.println("Error: " + e.getMessage());
094|            System.out.println("Please restart the process with valid data.");
095|        } catch (Exception e) {
096|            System.out.println("Unexpected error: " + e.getMessage());
097|            e.printStackTrace();
098|        } finally {
099|            // Clean up resources
100|            scanner.close();
101|            System.out.println("\nResources cleaned up.");
102|        }
103|    }
104|    
105|    /**
106|     * Simulates user filling out the note form
107|     * @return Note object with user-provided data
108|     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if validation fails
109|     */
110|    private Note fillNoteForm() throws IllegalArgumentException {
111|        System.out.println("\nEvent 2: User fills out the form");
112|        System.out.println("----------------------------------------");
113|        
114|        // Get student information
115|        System.out.print("Enter student name: ");
116|        String student = scanner.nextLine().trim();
117|        if (student.isEmpty()) {
118|            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Student name cannot be empty");
119|        }
120|        
121|        // Get date with validation
122|        LocalDate date = null;
123|        while (date == null) {
124|            System.out.print("Enter date (YYYY-MM-DD): ");
125|            String dateStr = scanner.nextLine().trim();
126|            try {
127|                date = LocalDate.parse(dateStr);
128|                // Validate date is not in the future
129|                if (date.isAfter(LocalDate.now())) {
130|                    System.out.println("Error: Date cannot be in the future");
131|                    date = null;
132|                }
133|            } catch (DateTimeParseException e) {
134|                System.out.println("Error: Invalid date format. Please use YYYY-MM-DD");
135|            }
136|        }
137|        
138|        // Get teacher information
139|        System.out.print("Enter teacher name: ");
140|        String teacher = scanner.nextLine().trim();
141|        if (teacher.isEmpty()) {
142|            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Teacher name cannot be empty");
143|        }
144|        
145|        // Get description
146|        System.out.print("Enter description: ");
147|        String description = scanner.nextLine().trim();
148|        if (description.isEmpty()) {
149|            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Description cannot be empty");
150|        }
151|        
152|        // Create and return the note
153|        Note note = new Note(student, date, teacher, description);
154|        System.out.println("\nForm completed successfully!");
155|        System.out.println("Preview:");
156|        System.out.println(note);
157|        
158|        return note;
159|    }
160|    
161|    /**
162|     * Handles postconditions after note insertion
163|     */
164|    private void handlePostconditions() {
165|        System.out.println("\n=== Postconditions ===");
166|        System.out.println("1. Note data entered into system ✓");
167|        System.out.println("2. Notification sent to parent ✓");
168|        
169|        // Return to registry screen
170|        System.out.println("3. Returning to registry screen...");
171|        simulateRegistryScreen();
172|        
173|        // SMOS server connection interrupted
174|        System.out.println("4. SMOS server connection interrupted");
175|        interruptSMOSConnection();
176|    }
177|    
178|    /**
179|     * Simulates returning to registry screen
180|     */
181|    private void simulateRegistryScreen() {
182|        System.out.println("   Displaying registry screen with all disciplinary notes...");
183|        // In a real application, this would navigate to the registry screen
184|        try {
185|            Thread.sleep(1000); // Simulate brief delay
186|        } catch (InterruptedException e) {
187|            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
188|        }
189|        System.out.println("   Registry screen loaded successfully ✓");
190|    }
191|    
192|    /**
193|     * Simulates interrupting SMOS server connection
194|     */
195|    private void interruptSMOSConnection() {
196|        System.out.println("   Interrupting connection to SMOS server...");
197|        // In a real application, this would close the SMOS connection
198|        try {
199|            Thread.sleep(500); // Simulate brief delay
200|        } catch (InterruptedException e) {
201|            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
202|        }
203|        System.out.println("   SMOS server connection interrupted ✓");
204|    }
205|    
206|    /**
207|     * Getter for NoteService (for testing purposes)
208|     * @return NoteService instance
209|     */
210|    protected NoteService getNoteService() {
211|        return noteService;
212|    }
213|    
214|    /**
215|     * Getter for EmailService (for testing purposes)
216|     * @return EmailService instance
217|     */
218|    protected EmailService getEmailService() {
219|        return emailService;
220|    }

'Command Engineer2.write_new_code executed: The file /home///baselines/MetaGPT/workspace/InsertNote_1766916129/src/main/java/com/example/insertnote/EmailService.java has been successfully created, with content:\npackage com.example.insertnote;\n\nimport java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;\nimport java.util.logging.Level;\nimport java.util.logging.Logger;\n\n/**\n * Service class for sending email notifications to parents.\n * Simulates email sending with appropriate error handling and retry logic.\n * In a real application, this would integrate with an email service provider.\n */\npublic class EmailService {\n    private static final Logger LOGGER = Logger.getLogger(EmailService.class.getName());\n    \n    // Configuration constants\n    private static final int MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS = 3;\n    private static final long RETRY_DELAY_MS = 1000;\n    private static final String EMAIL_SUBJECT = "Disciplinary Note Notification";\n    private static final String EMAIL_FROM = "school@example.edu";\n    \n    /**\n     * Sends a notification email to the parent regarding a disciplinary note.\n     * This method simulates email sending and includes error handling.\n     * \n     * @param note The disciplinary note for which to send notification\n     * @return true if email was sent successfully, false otherwise\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if note is null\n     */\n    public boolean sendNotificationToParent(Note note) {\n        if (note == null) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Note cannot be null");\n        }\n        \n        try {\n            // Validate note before processing\n            note.validate();\n            \n            // Get parent email from note (in real system, this would be from database)\n            String parentEmail = note.getParentEmail();\n            \n            LOGGER.info("Preparing to send email to parent: " + parentEmail);\n            \n            // Attempt to send email with retry logic\n            for (int attempt = 1; attempt <= MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS; attempt++) {\n                try {\n                    LOGGER.info("Email send attempt " + attempt + " of " + MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS);\n                    \n                    // Simulate email sending (in real system, this would use JavaMail or similar)\n                    boolean success = simulateEmailSending(note, parentEmail);\n                    \n                    if (success) {\n                        LOGGER.info("Email sent successfully to " + parentEmail);\n                        logEmailDetails(note, parentEmail);\n                        return true;\n                    } else {\n                        LOGGER.warning("Email sending failed on attempt " + attempt);\n                        \n                        // If not the last attempt, wait before retrying\n                        if (attempt < MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS) {\n                            LOGGER.info("Retrying in " + RETRY_DELAY_MS + "ms...");\n                            TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS.sleep(RETRY_DELAY_MS);\n                        }\n                    }\n                } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n                    LOGGER.log(Level.WARNING, "Email sending interrupted", e);\n                    Thread.currentThread().interrupt();\n                    return false;\n                } catch (Exception e) {\n                    LOGGER.log(Level.SEVERE, "Unexpected error during email sending attempt " + attempt, e);\n                    \n                    // For unexpected errors, we still retry unless it\'s the last attempt\n                    if (attempt == MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS) {\n                        LOGGER.severe("All email sending attempts failed");\n                        return false;\n                    }\n                    \n                    try {\n                        TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS.sleep(RETRY_DELAY_MS);\n                    } catch (InterruptedException ie) {\n                        Thread.currentThread().interrupt();\n                        return false;\n                    }\n                }\n            }\n            \n            LOGGER.severe("Failed to send email after " + MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS + " attempts");\n            return false;\n            \n        } catch (IllegalStateException e) {\n            LOGGER.log(Level.SEVERE, "Cannot send email: Note validation failed", e);\n            return false;\n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            LOGGER.log(Level.SEVERE, "Unexpected error in email sending process", e);\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates the actual email sending process.\n     * In a real implementation, this would use JavaMail API or similar.\n     * \n     * @param note The disciplinary note\n     * @param parentEmail The parent\'s email address\n     * @return true if simulation succeeds, false if simulation fails\n     */\n    private boolean simulateEmailSending(Note note, String parentEmail) {\n        // Simulate network/email service issues with a 10% failure rate\n        if (Math.random() < 0.1) {\n            LOGGER.warning("Simulated email service failure for: " + parentEmail);\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Simulate email construction and sending\n        String emailBody = constructEmailBody(note);\n        \n        // In a real system, this would be:\n        // Properties props = new Properties();\n        // props.put("mail.smtp.host", "smtp.example.com");\n        // Session session = Session.getInstance(props);\n        // Message message = new MimeMessage(session);\n        // message.setFrom(new InternetAddress(EMAIL_FROM));\n        // message.setRecipients(Message.RecipientType.TO, InternetAddress.parse(parentEmail));\n        // message.setSubject(EMAIL_SUBJECT);\n        // message.setText(emailBody);\n        // Transport.send(message);\n        \n        // For simulation, just log the email details\n        LOGGER.fine("Simulated email sent:");\n        LOGGER.fine("  From: " + EMAIL_FROM);\n        LOGGER.fine("  To: " + parentEmail);\n        LOGGER.fine("  Subject: " + EMAIL_SUBJECT);\n        LOGGER.fine("  Body: " + emailBody.substring(0, Math.min(100, emailBody.length())) + "...");\n        \n        // Simulate sending delay\n        try {\n            TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS.sleep(500);\n        } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructs the email body for the disciplinary note notification.\n     * \n     * @param note The disciplinary note\n     * @return Formatted email body\n     */\n    private String constructEmailBody(Note note) {\n        return "Dear Parent/Guardian,\\n\\n" +\n               "This is to inform you that a disciplinary note has been recorded for your child.\\n\\n" +\n               "Details:\\n" +\n               "  Student: " + note.getStudent() + "\\n" +\n               "  Date: " + note.getDate() + "\\n" +\n               "  Teacher: " + note.getTeacher() + "\\n" +\n               "  Description: " + note.getDescription() + "\\n\\n" +\n               "Please contact the school LOGGER.info("Note saved to database for student: " + note.getStudent());\n            \n            // Step 4: Send email notification to parent\n            LOGGER.info("Triggering email notification logNoteOperation(note, "INSERT");\n            \n            return true;\n            \n        } catch (IllegalStateException e) {\n            LOGGER.log(Level.SEVERE, "Note validation failed: " + In a real system, this would involve:\n            // 1. Opening database connection\n            // 2. Executing INSERT statement\n            // 3. Handling transactions\n            // 4. Closing resources\n            \n            // Simulate occasional database failures (5% chance)\n            if (Math.random() < 0.05) {\n                LOGGER.severe("Simulated database connection failure");\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n            // Add note to the list (simulating database insert)\n            notesDatabase.add(note.copy()); // Store a copy to prevent external modification\n            \n            // Simulate database write delay\n            Thread.sleep(100);\n            \n            LOGGER.fine("Note saved to simulated database: " + note.getStudent());\n            return true;\n            \n        } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n            LOGGER.log(Level.WARNING, "Database operation interrupted", e);\n Simple duplicate detection: same student, same date, similar description\n        return notesDatabase.stream()\n                .anyMatch(existingNote -> \n                    existingNote.getStudent().equalsIgnoreCase(note.getStudent()) &&\n                    existingNote.getDate().equals(note.getDate()) &&\n                    existingNote.getDescription().toLowerCase()\n                        .contains(note.getDescription().toLowerCase().substring(0, \n                            Math.min(10, (note.getStudent().equalsIgnoreCase(studentName.trim())) {\n                result.add(note.copy());\n            }\n        }\n        \n        LOGGER.fine("Found " + result.size() + " notes for System.out.println("Please restart the process with valid data.");\n095|        } catch (Exception e) {\n096|            System.out.println("Unexpected error: " + e.getMessage());\n097| System.out.println("----------------------------------------");\n113|        \n114|        // Get student information\n115|        System.out.print("Enter student name: ");\n116|        String student date with validation\n122|        LocalDate date = null;\n123|        while (date == null) {\n124|            System.out.print("Enter date (YYYY-MM-DD): ");\n125|            String dateStr = System saves note and sends email notification to parent\n * \n * Postconditions:\n * - Note data entered into system\n * - Notification sent to parent\n * - Returns to registry screen\n * - SMOS server connection interrupted\n */\npublic class InsertNoteProgram {\n    \n    // Serv used by the program\n    private NoteService noteService;\n    private EmailService emailService;\n    private Scanner scanner;\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructor initializes serv and scanner\n     */\n    public InsertNoteProgram() {\n        this.noteService = new NoteService();\n        this.emailService = new EmailService();\n        this.scanner = new Scanner(System.in);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Main method - entry point of the program\n     * @param args command line arguments (not used)\n     */\n    public static void main(String[] args) {\n        System.out.println("=== InsertNote Use Case Simulation ===");\n        System.out.println("Preconditions checked:");\n        System.out.println("1. Please try again.");\n            }\n            \n        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error: " + e.getMessage());\n            System.out.println("Please restart the process with valid data.");\n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            System.out.println("Unexpected error: " + e.getMessage());\n            e.printStackTrace();\n        } finally {\n            // Clean up resources\n            scanner.close();\n            System.out.println("\\nResources cleaned up.");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates user filling out the note form\n     * @return Note object with user-provided data\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if validation fails\n     */\n    private Note fillNoteForm() throws IllegalArgumentException {\n        System.out.println("\\nEvent 2: User fills out the form");\n        System.out.println("----------------------------------------");\n        \n        // Get student information\n        System.out.print("Enter student name: ");\n        String student = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        if (student.isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Student name cannot be empty");\n        }\n        \n        // Get date with validation\n        LocalDate date = null;\n        while (date == null) {\n            System.out.print("Enter date (YYYY-MM-DD): ");\n            String dateStr = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            try {\n                date = LocalDate.parse(dateStr);\n                // Validate date is not in the future\n                if (date.isAfter(LocalDate.now())) {\n                    System.out.println("Error: Date cannot be in the future");\n                    date = null;\n                }\n            } catch (DateTimeParseException e) {\n                System.out.println("Error: Invalid date format. Please use YYYY-MM-DD");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        // Get teacher information\n        System.out.print("Enter teacher name: ");\n        String teacher = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        if (teacher.isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Teacher name cannot be empty");\n        }\n        \n        // Get description\n        System.out.print("Enter description: ");\n        String description = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        if (description.isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Description cannot be empty");\n        }\n        \n        // Create and return the note\n        Note note = new Note(student, date, teacher, description);\n        System.out.println("\\nForm completed successfully!");\n        System.out.println("Preview:");\n        System.out.println(note);\n        \n        return note;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Handles postconditions after note insertion\n     */\n    private void handlePostconditions() {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Postconditions ===");\n        System.out.println("1. SMOS server connection interrupted");\n        interruptSMOSConnection();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates returning to registry screen\n     */\n    private void simulateRegistryScreen() {\n        System.out.println("   Displaying registry screen with all disciplinary notes...");\n        // In a real application, this would navigate to the registry screen\n        try {\n            Thread.sleep(1000); // Simulate brief delay\n        } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();\n        }\n        System.out.println("   Registry screen loaded successfully ✓");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates interrupting SMOS server connection\n     */\n    private void interruptSMOSConnection() {\n        System.out.println("   Interrupting connection to SMOS server...");\n        // In a real application, this would close the SMOS connection\n        try {\n            Thread.sleep(500); // Simulate brief delay\n        } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();\n        }\n        System.out.println("   SMOS server connection interrupted ✓");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Getter for NoteService (for testing purposes)\n     * @return NoteService instance\n     */\n    protected NoteService getNoteService() {\n        return noteService;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Getter for EmailService (for testing purposes)\n     * @return EmailService instance\n     */\n    protected EmailService getEmailService() {\n        return emailService;\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': 'Thought: I have created the main class InsertNoteProgram.java with a fairly complete implementation.     * @param note The disciplinary note for which to send notification\n     * @return true if email was sent successfully, false otherwise\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if note is null\n     */\n    public boolean sendNotificationToParent(Note note) {\n        if (note == null) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Note cannot be null");\n        }\n        \n        try logic\n            for (int attempt = 1; attempt <= MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS; attempt++) {\n                try {\n                    LOGGER.info("Email send attempt " + attempt + " of " + MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS);\n                    \n                    // Simulate email sending (in real system, this would use JavaMail or similar)\n                    boolean success = simulateEmailSending(note, parentEmail);\n                    \n                    if (success) {\n                        LOGGER.info("Email sent successfully to " + parentEmail);\n LOGGER.info("Retrying in " + RETRY_DELAY_MS + "ms...");\n                            TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS.sleep(RETRY_DELAY_MS);\n                        }\n                    }\n                } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n                    LOGGER.log(Level.WARNING, "Email sending interrupted", e);\n                    Thread.currentThread().interrupt();\n                    return false;\n                } catch (Exception e) {\n                    LOGGER.log(Level.SEVERE, "Unexpected error during email sending attempt " + attempt, e);\n                    \n                    // For unexpected errors, we still retry unless it\'s the last attempt\n                    if (attempt == MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS) {\n                        LOGGER.severe("All email sending attempts failed");\n                        return false;\n                    }\n                    \n                    try {\n                        TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS.sleep(RETRY_DELAY_MS);\n           // For this system, we allow duplicates but log a warning\n            }\n            \n            // Step 3: Save to simulated database\n            boolean saved = saveToDatabase(note);\n In a real system, this would involve:\n            // 1. Opening database connection\n            // 2. Executing INSERT statement\n            // 3. Handling transactions\n            // 4. Closing resources\n            \n            // Simulate occasional database failures (5% chance)\n            if (Math.random() < 0.05) {\n                LOGGER.severe("Simulated database connection note.getStudent());\n            return true;\n            \n        } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n            LOGGER.log(Level.WARNING, "Database operation interrupted", e);\n false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if a similar note already exists in the database.\n     * This is a simple duplicate detection - in a real system, this would be more sophisticated.\n     * \n     * @param note The note to check\n     * @return true if a similar note exists, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean isDuplicateNote(Note note) {\n        // Simple duplicate detection: same student, same date, similar description\n        return notesDatabase.stream()\n                .anyMatch(existingNote -> \n                    existingNote.getStudent().equalsIgnoreCase(note.getStudent()) &&\n                    existingNote.getDate().equals(note.getDate()) &&\n                    existingNote.getDescription().toLowerCase()\n                        .contains(note.getDescription().toLowerCase().substring(0, \n                            Math.min(10, copies = new ArrayList<>();\n        for (Note note : notesDatabase) {\n            copies.add(note.copy());\n        }\n        return copies;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Finds notes by student {\n        if (studentName == null || studentName.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Student name cannot be null or empty");\n        }\n        \n        LOGGER.fine("Searching notes for student: " + studentName);\n        List<Note> result = new ArrayList<>();\n        \n        for (Note note : notesDatabase) {\n            if (note.getStudent().equalsIgnoreCase(studentName.trim())) {\n                result.add(note.copy());\n            }\n        }\n        \n        LOGGER.fine("Found " + result.size() + " notes for student: " + studentName);\n        return result;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the total number of notes in the system.\n     * \n     * @return Count of notes\n     */\n    public int getNoteCount() {\n        return notesDatabase.size();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Clears all notes from the simulated database.\n     * WARNING: This is for testing/cleanup purposes only.\n     */\n    public void clearAllNotes() {\n        LOGGER.warning("Clearing all notes from database - total notes: " + notesDatabase.size());\n        notesDatabase.clear();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * private void logNoteOperation(Note note, String operation) {\n        LOGGER.info("Note operation audit:");\n        LOGGER.info("  Operation: " + operation);\n        LOGGER.info("  Student: " + 'Command Engineer2.write_new_code executed: The file /home///baselines/MetaGPT/workspace/InsertNote_1766916129/src/main/java/com/example/insertnote/EmailService.java has been successfully created, with content:\npackage com.example.insertnote;\n\nimport java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;\nimport java.util.logging.Level;\nimport java.util.logging.Logger;\n\n/**\n * Service class for sending email notifications to parents.\n * Simulates email sending with appropriate error handling and retry logic.\n * In a real application, this would integrate with an email service provider.\n */\npublic class EmailService {\n    private static final Logger LOGGER = Logger.getLogger(EmailService.class.getName());\n    \n    // Configuration constants\n    private static final int MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS = 3;\n    private static final long RETRY_DELAY_MS = 1000;\n    private static final String EMAIL_SUBJECT = "Disciplinary Note Notification";\n    private static final String EMAIL_FROM = "school@example.edu";\n    \n    /**\n     * Sends a notification email to the parent regarding a disciplinary note.\n     * This method simulates email sending and includes error handling.\n     * \n     * @param note The disciplinary note for which to send notification\n     * @return true if email was sent successfully, false otherwise\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if note is null\n     */\n    public boolean sendNotificationToParent(Note note) {\n        if (note == null) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Note cannot be null");\n        }\n        \n        try {\n            // Validate note before processing\n            note.validate();\n            \n            // Get parent email from note (in real system, this would be from database)\n            String parentEmail = note.getParentEmail();\n            \n            LOGGER.info("Preparing to send email to parent: " + parentEmail);\n            \n            // Attempt to send email with retry logic\n            for (int attempt = 1; attempt <= MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS; attempt++) {\n                try {\n                    LOGGER.info("Email send attempt " + attempt + " of " + MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS);\n                    \n                    // Simulate email sending (in real system, this would use JavaMail or similar)\n                    boolean success = simulateEmailSending(note, parentEmail);\n                    \n                    if (success) {\n                        LOGGER.info("Email sent successfully to " + parentEmail);\n                        logEmailDetails(note, parentEmail);\n                        return true;\n                    } else {\n                        LOGGER.warning("Email sending failed on attempt " + attempt);\n                        \n                        // If not the last attempt, wait before retrying\n                        if (attempt < MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS) {\n                            LOGGER.info("Retrying in " + RETRY_DELAY_MS + "ms...");\n                            TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS.sleep(RETRY_DELAY_MS);\n                        }\n                    }\n                } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n                    LOGGER.log(Level.WARNING, "Email sending interrupted", e);\n                    Thread.currentThread().interrupt();\n                    return false;\n                } catch (Exception e) {\n                    LOGGER.log(Level.SEVERE, "Unexpected error during email sending attempt " + attempt, e);\n                    \n                    // For unexpected errors, we still retry unless it\'s the last attempt\n                    if (attempt == MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS) {\n                        LOGGER.severe("All email sending attempts failed");\n                        return false;\n                    }\n                    \n                    try {\n                        TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS.sleep(RETRY_DELAY_MS);\n                    } catch (InterruptedException ie) {\n                        Thread.currentThread().interrupt();\n                        return false;\n                    }\n                }\n            }\n            \n            LOGGER.severe("Failed to send email after " + MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS + " attempts");\n            return false;\n            \n        } catch (IllegalStateException e) {\n            LOGGER.log(Level.SEVERE, "Cannot send email: Note validation failed", e);\n            return false;\n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            LOGGER.log(Level.SEVERE, "Unexpected error in email sending process", e);\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates the actual email sending process.\n     * In a real implementation, this would use JavaMail API or similar.\n     * \n     * @param note The disciplinary note\n     * @param parentEmail The parent\'s email address\n     * @return true if simulation succeeds, false if simulation fails\n     */\n    private boolean simulateEmailSending(Note note, String parentEmail) {\n        // Simulate network/email service issues with a 10% failure rate\n        if (Math.random() < 0.1) {\n            LOGGER.warning("Simulated email service failure for: " + parentEmail);\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Simulate email construction and sending\n        String emailBody = constructEmailBody(note);\n        \n        // In a real system, this would be:\n        // Properties props = new Properties();\n        // props.put("mail.smtp.host", "smtp.example.com");\n        // Session session = Session.getInstance(props);\n        // Message message = new MimeMessage(session);\n        // message.setFrom(new InternetAddress(EMAIL_FROM));\n        // message.setRecipients(Message.RecipientType.TO, InternetAddress.parse(parentEmail));\n        // message.setSubject(EMAIL_SUBJECT);\n        // message.setText(emailBody);\n        // Transport.send(message);\n        \n        // For simulation, just log the email details\n        LOGGER.fine("Simulated email sent:");\n        LOGGER.fine("  From: " + EMAIL_FROM);\n        LOGGER.fine("  To: " + parentEmail);\n        LOGGER.fine("  Subject: " + EMAIL_SUBJECT);\n        LOGGER.fine("  Body: " + emailBody.substring(0, Math.min(100, emailBody.length())) + "...");\n        \n        // Simulate sending delay\n        try {\n            TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS.sleep(500);\n        } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructs the email body for the disciplinary note notification.\n     * \n     * @param note The disciplinary note\n     * @return Formatted email body\n     */\n    private String constructEmailBody(Note note) {\n        return "Dear Parent/Guardian,\\n\\n" +\n               "This is to inform you that a disciplinary note has been recorded for your child.\\n\\n" +\n               "Details:\\n" +\n               "  Student: " + note.getStudent() + "\\n" +\n               "  Date: " + note.getDate() + "\\n" +\n               "  Teacher: " + note.getTeacher() + "\\n" +\n               "  Description: " + note.getDescription() + "\\n\\n" +\n               "Please contact the school administration if you have any questions.\\n\\n" +\n               "Sincerely,\\n" +\n               "School Administration\\n" +\n               "---\\n" +\n               "This is an automated notification.           // For this system, we allow duplicates but log a warning\n            }\n            \n            // Step 3: Save to simulated database\n            boolean saved = saveToDatabase(note);\n LOGGER.info("Note saved to database for student: " + note.getStudent());\n            \n            // Step 4: Send email notification to parent\n            LOGGER.info("Triggering email notification                  ", but note was saved to database");\n                // Note: The note is still saved even if email fails\n                // This is a business decision - some systems might require successful email\n                // For this use case, we consider the note saved successfully\n            }\n            \n            // Step 5: Log the operation for auditing\n            logNoteOperation(note, "INSERT");\n            \n            return true;\n            \n        } catch (IllegalStateException e) {\n            LOGGER.log(Level.SEVERE, "Note validation failed: " + In a real system, this would involve:\n            // 1. Opening database connection\n            // 2. Executing INSERT statement\n            // 3. Handling transactions\n            // 4. Closing resources\n            \n            // Simulate occasional database failures (5% chance)\n            if (Math.random() < 0.05) {\n                LOGGER.severe("Simulated database connection failure");\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n            // Add note to the list (simulating database insert)\n            notesDatabase.add(note.copy()); // Store a copy to prevent external modification\n            \n            // Simulate database write delay\n            Thread.sleep(100);\n            \n            LOGGER.fine("Note saved to simulated database: " + note.getStudent());\n            return true;\n            \n        } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n            LOGGER.log(Level.WARNING, "Database operation interrupted", e);\n            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();\n            return false;\n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            LOGGER.log(Level.SEVERE, "Database error while saving note", e);\n            return Simple duplicate detection: same student, same date, similar description\n        return notesDatabase.stream()\n                .anyMatch(existingNote -> \n                    existingNote.getStudent().equalsIgnoreCase(note.getStudent()) &&\n                    existingNote.getDate().equals(note.getDate()) &&\n                    existingNote.getDescription().toLowerCase()\n                        .contains(note.getDescription().toLowerCase().substring(0, \n                            Math.min(10, (note.getStudent().equalsIgnoreCase(studentName.trim())) {\n                result.add(note.copy());\n            }\n        }\n        \n        LOGGER.fine("Found " + result.size() + " notes for [{'command_name': 'Editor.write', 'args': {'path': '/home///baselines/MetaGPT/workspace/InsertNote_1766916129/src/main/java/com/example/insertnote/InsertNoteProgram.java', 'content': 'package com.example.insertnote;\n\nimport java.time.LocalDate;\nimport java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter;\nimport java.time.format.DateTimeParseException;\nimport java.util.Scanner;\n\n/**\n * Main program to simulate the InsertNote use case.\n * This program demonstrates the sequence of events for inserting a disciplinary note:\n * 1. Show form with fields (student, date, teacher, description)\n * 2. User fills the form\n * 3. User clicks "Save"\n * 4. System saves note and sends email notification to parent\n * \n * Postconditions:\n * - Note data entered into system\n * - Notification sent to parent\n * - Returns to registry screen\n * - SMOS server connection interrupted\n */\npublic class InsertNoteProgram {\n    \n    // Serv used by the program\n    private NoteService noteService;\n    private EmailService emailService;\n    private Scanner scanner;\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructor initializes serv and scanner\n     */\n    public InsertNoteProgram() {\n        this.noteService = new NoteService();\n        this.emailService = new EmailService();\n        this.scanner = new Scanner(System.in);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Main method - entry point of the program\n     * @param args command line arguments (not used)\n     */\n    public static void main(String[] args) {\n        System.out.println("=== InsertNote Use Case Simulation ===");\n        System.out.println("Preconditions checked:");\n        System.out.println("1. User logged in as administrator ✓");\n        System.out.println("2. \'SviewTetTingloregister\' use case completed ✓");\n        System.out.println("3. \'ViewElonconote\' use case completed ✓");\n        System.out.println("4. \'New Note\' button clicked ✓\\n");\n        \n        InsertNoteProgram program = new InsertNoteProgram();\n        program.runUseCase();\n        \n        System.out.println("\\n=== Use Case Completed Successfully ===");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Runs the complete InsertNote use case sequence\n     */\n    private void runUseCase() {\n        try {\n            // Event 1: Show form with fields\n            System.out.println("Event 1: System shows form with the following fields:");\n            System.out.println("----------------------------------------");\n            \n            // Event 2: User fills out the form\n            Note note = fillNoteForm();\n            \n            // Event 3: User clicks "Save"\n            System.out.println("\\nEvent 3: User clicks \'Save\' button");\n            \n            // Event 4: Save the note (includes sending notification)\n            System.out.println("\\nEvent 4: System processing...");\n            boolean success = noteService.saveNote(note);\n            \n            if (success) {\n                System.out.println("✓ Note saved successfully!");\n                System.out.println("✓ Email notification sent as part of save process!");\n                \n                // Postconditions\n                handlePostconditions();\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("✗ Failed to save note. Please try again.");\n            }\n            \n        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error: " + e.getMessage());\n            System.out.println("Please restart the process with valid data.");\n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            System.out.println("Unexpected error: " + e.getMessage());\n            e.printStackTrace();\n        } finally {\n            // Clean up resources\n            scanner.close();\n            System.out.println("\\nResources cleaned up.");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates user filling out the note form\n     * @return Note object with user-provided data\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if validation fails\n     */\n    private Note fillNoteForm() throws IllegalArgumentException {\n        System.out.println("\\nEvent 2: User fills out the form");\n        System.out.println("----------------------------------------");\n        \n        // Get student information\n        System.out.print("Enter student name: ");\n        String student = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        if (student.isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Student name cannot be empty");\n        }\n        \n        // Get date with validation\n        LocalDate date = null;\n        while (date == null) {\n            System.out.print("Enter date (YYYY-MM-DD): ");\n            String dateStr = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            try {\n                date = LocalDate.parse(dateStr);\n                // Validate date is not in the future\n                if (date.isAfter(LocalDate.now())) {\n                    System.out.println("Error: Date cannot be in the future");\n                    date = null;\n                }\n            } catch (DateTimeParseException e) {\n                System.out.println("Error: Invalid date format. Please use YYYY-MM-DD");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        // Get teacher information\n        System.out.print("Enter teacher name: ");\n        String teacher = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        if (teacher.isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Teacher name cannot be empty");\n        }\n        \n        // Get description\n        System.out.print("Enter description: ");\n        String description = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        if (description.isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Description cannot be empty");\n        }\n        \n        // Create and return the note\n        Note note = new Note(student, date, teacher, description);\n        System.out.println("\\nForm completed successfully!");\n        System.out.println("Preview:");\n        System.out.println(note);\n        \n        return note;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Handles postconditions after note insertion\n     */\n    private void handlePostconditions() {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Postconditions ===");\n        System.out.println("1. Note data entered into system ✓");\n        System.out.println("2. Notification sent to parent ✓");\n        \n        // Return to registry screen\n        System.out.println("3. Returning to registry screen...");\n        simulateRegistryScreen();\n        \n        // SMOS server connection interrupted\n        System.out.println("4. SMOS server connection interrupted");\n        interruptSMOSConnection();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates returning to registry screen\n     */\n    private void simulateRegistryScreen() {\n        System.out.println("   Displaying registry screen with all disciplinary notes...");\n        // In a real application, this would navigate to the registry screen\n        try {\n            Thread.sleep(1000); // Simulate brief delay\n        } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();\n        }\n        System.out.println("   Registry screen loaded successfully ✓");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates interrupting SMOS server connection\n     */\n    private void interruptSMOSConnection() {\n        System.out.println("   Interrupting connection to SMOS server...");\n        // In a real application, this would close the SMOS connection\n        try {\n            Thread.sleep(500); // Simulate brief delay\n        } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();\n        }\n        System.out.println("   SMOS server connection interrupted ✓");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Getter for NoteService (for testing purposes)\n     * @return NoteService instance\n     */\n    protected NoteService getNoteService() {\n        return noteService;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Getter for EmailService (for testing purposes)\n     * @return EmailService instance\n     */\n    protected EmailService getEmailService() {\n        return emailService;\n    }\n}\n'}}, {'command_name': 'Plan.finish_current_task', 'args': {}}]

Examples: >>> cr = CodeReview() >>> await cr.review(patch_path=\\"https://github.com/geekan/MetaGPT/pull/136\\", output_file=\\"cr/MetaGPT_136.json\\") >>> await cr.review(patch_path=\\"/data/uploads/dev-master.diff\\", output_file=\\"cr/dev-master.json\\") >>> await cr.review(patch_path=\\"/data/uploads/main.py\\", output_file=\\"cr/main.json\\")"}}, "tool_path": "metagpt/tools/libs/cr.py"}, "ImageGetter": {"type": "class", "description": "A tool to get images.", "methods": {"get_image": {"type": "async_function", "description": "Get an image related to the search term. "school@example.edu";\n    \n    /**\n     * Sends a notification email to the parent regarding a disciplinary note.\n     * This method simulates email sending and includes error handling.\n     * \n     * @param note The disciplinary note for which to send notification\n     * @return true if email was sent successfully, false otherwise\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if note is null\n     */\n    public boolean sendNotificationToParent(Note note) {\n        if (note == null) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Note cannot be null");\n        }\n        \n        try {\n            // Validate note before processing\n            note.validate();\n            \n            // Get parent email from note (in real system, this would be from database)\n logic\n            for (int attempt = 1; attempt <= MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS; attempt++) {\n                try {\n                    LOGGER.info("Email send attempt " + attempt + " of " + MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS);\n                    \n                    // Simulate email sending (in real system, this would use JavaMail or similar)\n                    boolean success = simulateEmailSending(note, parentEmail);\n                    \n                    if (success) {\n                        LOGGER.info("Email sent successfully to " + parentEmail);\n                        logEmailDetails(note, parentEmail);\n                        return true;\n                    } else {\n                        LOGGER.warning("Email sending failed on attempt " + attempt);\n                        \n                        // If not the last attempt, wait before retrying\n                        if (attempt < MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS) {\n                            LOGGER.info("Retrying in " + RETRY_DELAY_MS + "ms...");\n                            TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS.sleep(RETRY_DELAY_MS);\n                        }\n                    }\n                } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n                    LOGGER.log(Level.WARNING, "Email sending interrupted", e);\n                    Thread.currentThread().interrupt();\n                    return false;\n                } catch (Exception e) {\n                    LOGGER.log(Level.SEVERE, "Unexpected error during email sending attempt " + attempt, e);\n                    \n                    // For unexpected errors, we still retry unless it\'s the last attempt\n                    if (attempt == MAX_RETRY_ATTEMPTS) {\n                        LOGGER.severe("All email sending attempts failed");\n                        return false;\n                    }\n                    \n                    try {\n                        TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS.sleep(RETRY_DELAY_MS);\n
